page.title: 03Grafham Water
page.content: To the west of Buckden, Diddington Brook and valley is now the site of a reservoir called Grafham Water.The reservoir,which supplies fifty million gallons of water a day to Beds.Bucks.Herts.Northants.and Cambs. draws it's water from the Great Ouse near Offord. The water is pumped through a sixteen foot diameter concrete lined tunnel to the furthest end of the resevoir. The dam wall has a minimum thickness of eight feet. When full the reservoir contains 1300 million gallons of water covering two and a half square miles with a depth of 70 feet.It was opened in July 1966 by H.R.H the Duke of Edinburgh. A number of farms and houses were lost due to its construction, evidence of which can be seen when the water level is low.
